intro: Trigonella polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited fenugreek, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with hairy stems and small yellow flowers. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to fenugreek. The botanical features of Trigonella polycarpa make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
